dialogues.Nic: Hi guys.   Sorry I'm late.  27 fibroids. All in the lining.  That's right, Smart Girl.   And we got `em all.  Hey, whose truck is that?  Yours?  What business?.. The gardening?       Hey, did you start on those thank- you notes for your birthday gifts?  I just think it's easier to knock them out when it's fresh.  Great...I mean, you don't want to have to start with an apology. You know? Then it's embarrassing.  Okay, I'll let it go... I mean, if it was up to you, our kids wouldn't even write thank-you notes, they'd just send out good vibes.  I can't believe my baby's 18.    12                                                               12   I just don't understand why you bought the truck now.  Okay. It just seems a little cart before the horse.  Sweetie, you don't even have any clients yet.    Look, I'm sorry. It's good you bought the truck. Its proactive.  Hey...  Wanna watch a movie?  Yeah. We haven't done that in a while.  are cozied up side-by-side facing the TV.   I don't like the guys in this one. They're too shaved.  How about the one with the biker gang?    Shit!!     Where's the remote?!  Jesus Christ!  The whole neighborhood heard that!  Well, that was a vibe kill.  Where are you going?  Don't be back late, okay?  Ugh. Maybe we should just sit him down and ask him already.  "Exploring" is the word I'd use...  We shouldn't... I just don't understand why he's exploring with that loser.  I feel like he has so much potential and he's just wasting it.  What do you mean, what am I trying to say?  What are you talking about?  Okay, honey, you're on a whole other tangent and I have no idea what you're talking about.  Yeah.   Maybe not.  35                                                                   35   Laser, your mom and I accept you and love you unconditionally? You know that, right?  And you know you can be open with us about anything.  Anything.     Anything on your mind.  That's okay.  Well, first I have to say we rarely watch that movie--  And secondly, I really don't appreciate you snooping around our room. Was that Clay's idea? I have to say again, I don't like him. He seems untended...!    Okay, that's enough! Laser, your mom and I have a sense there's some other stuff going on in your life and we just want to be let in.  You could tell us, honey. We'd understand and support you.  What do you mean once?  Who did you meet once?  Who's Paul?!  Forget the set-up!   Who is Paul?!!  But why didn't you tell us?   Whoa! Whoa! No. No way. Nobody is seeing anyone until we meet him!  43                                                           43    Yeah, I get it. He's their biological father and all that crap but it still feels really shitty. Like we're not enough or something, you know?  Jesus, Jules! The plumber was just here!  44                                                             44     Let's just kill him with kindness and put it to bed.  I love you, chicken.  Paul! It is so great to meet you. I'm Nic. This is Jules.  Great.   Well, come on in.  Are you kidding? We love it. And a Petit Syrah. What a treat! Let me get some glasses.    Okay. And same goes for the micro- managing...  So Paul, did you always know you wanted to be in food-services industry?  No, I was asking because I remember reading in your file, back when we were looking for, you know, sperm, anyway, you said you were studying international relations.    Yeah, I got it, Laser. Thanks. So, Paul, what about your social life?  You know, are you married, divorced, seeing anyone?  What?   We're getting to know Paul.  Oh.  We met at UCLA. I was a resident in the ER and Jules had an emergency.  Well it was pretty clear to me she was just having an anxiety attack and she'd be fine.  Gave her a Vallium. Tried to get her to relax, talk, move her tongue around.  I was trying to distract you.  You were really pretty.  And we've been glued at the hip ever since.  Hey Paul, did Joni tell you about her graduation speech?  It was incredible. So full of wisdom and hope... Hon, go get it. I'm sure he'd love to hear it...  Sure he would.   Come on.   Go get it...  Sweetie, don't be embarrassed.  Actually, it's my third.    But thanks for counting.  ...I'm just saying, the plan was to limit his involvement--  He's not just a client, Jules. He's our sperm donor! Have you ever heard the phrase "Don't Shit Where You Eat?"  I'm sorry. He just seemed sort of...self-satisfied to me.    What's the score?  So how'd it go today?  What is it?     Don't tell me to settle, mister. And if it's not in the mail by tomorrow morning, we're not going to the Dodger game Saturday.  What other plans? I'm asking you a quest--  You used to be so cute!  57                                                                57   Come here.     Sit down.  I'm sorry I've been such a bitch lately. I know I'm not being my highest self.  You've been really patient with me. I just want you to know that hasn't gone unrecognized.  Get in.  How's the water?  In a bit.     You enjoy it first.  Oh, I forgot the lavender salts.  No, I meant to put `em in....  Don't move...  No, we're planning on being here through mid-August so... No, I promise, I'm not going anywhere.  62                                                                 62   So how'd it go with Paul?  I don't know. Did you break ground? Did you dig in? I don't know the terms.  Oh, so it was less of a "doing" day, huh? Was he okay with that?  Okay.   You're right.  Quit telling me to relax!  What the fuck...!  Funny how someone conveniently forgot to tell me they were driving home on a motorcycle!  You know how many people I've seen come into the hospital paralyzed from motorcycle accidents?!  That is so not the point I'm making! Joni knows this is something I'd never allow.  Yeah, well, you're living here now!  She's never talked to me like that.    Oh, nothing. Paul's just giving me child-rearing lessons.  Listen, when you've been a parent for 18 years, come talk to me!  Yeah, and I need your observations like I need a dick in my ass!  Joni? I was just upset. You know how I feel about motorcycles.  Oh, yeah, they're spending all kinds of quality time together.  No, everyone's getting along famously. Apparently Paul can do no wrong...  Can we get another bottle of the Seavey Cabernet?  Oh, just fucking kill me...  I'm sorry guys, but I just can't, with the fucking hemp milk and the organic farming and heirloom tomatoes. "Oh no, don't throw that in the trash, no man, you gotta throw that into the composting bin so the fucking worms can shit all over it and turn it into glorious multch and we can all feel better about ourselves." God! What a bunch of bullshit!  You know what, Jules?! I like my wine! Okay? So fucking sue me! And fyi, red wine has a chemical called Resveratrol in it, which has been proven to significantly extend human lifespan!  Fuck you.  This whole Paul thing is driving me crazy! I feel like he's taking over my family.      Look, I'm sorry, I just feel like I'm carrying the whole load here.  What are you talking about?  That is just not true!  What are you talking about? I just helped you start another business!  No, so you can feel better about yourself!  No. Just the check please.  84                                                                   84     Look, I know you've all been enjoying your time with Paul. It looks great, honey. Very indigenous. I'm so proud of you.  Hey, so how's that guy Luis working out?    Whoa.   What kind of drugs?  You know what, I think I'm gonna stick with water tonight. Exactly what rare's supposed to be.  Ugh, isn't that annoying? That happens to me all the time when I'm grilling.  Right?!   It means bloody!    You don't meet too many straight guys who love Joni Mitchell.    What's your favorite Joni album?  Oh God, I probably spent half of high school in my room crying to that album. That record kills me.  "A Case of You..."  Mmm!!  I am on a lonely road and I am traveling traveling, traveling, traveling/Looking for something, what can it be/Oh I hate you some, I hate you some/I love you some Oh I love you/when I forget about me...  I want to talk to you/I want to shampoo you/I want to renew you again and again/Applause, applause/ Life is our cause/When I think of your kisses/My mind see-saws...  Do you see/do you see/do you see how you hu-urt me baby/so I hurt you too/then we both get/soo-ooo- ooo blue...  I like this guy.    You know what? I think I will try some of that Screaming Eagle.  Paul and Jules talking comfortably. Joni and Laser chiming in, smiling, one big happy family.      97                                                                 97   You're sleeping with him, aren't you.  Just be honest with me. What?!  What?   To be fucked?  It's always what I'm not doing for you, isn't it? Well here's what I don't to you. I don't work out my issues by fucking other people!  No, you had to go fuck our sperm donor! You couldn't have picked a more painful way to hurt me...  I need water! My mouth is dry!  110                                                                110    Is your back okay?  You should take some Advil.  I hope you had a designated driver.  Well, you seem drunk to me.    No, you're not!    I'm not done talking to you!  Did you pack that lamp I gave you?  Well, we can always get stuff up there, too, if you need it, I mean if the room's dark or you need extra bedding...  You've got some balls, mister!  No, you hold on! Let me tell you something, you really hurt my kids!    If you want a family so much, go out and make one of your own!  We had to move the car.  Give us some credit.  No?   Why's that?  Thanks, Laser.

That was...I don't know where that came from...  Okay.   I'm gonna go now...    62                                                                 62     No, we just talked...conceptually.  You know, maybe we should lay off the Paul digs a little.  And I also think we should start composting.  Relax. She'll get home when she gets home.  What's going on?  Paul?  Look, I'm sorry about last night. I'm really embarrassed.  I know, she's just going through a lot of stuff right now...  And look, I just want you to know, about the other day, the kiss, that's not something I...do.  I just wanted to clear the air.  Paul, I can't!  No, I do! It's just... I have a guy outside!  Oh.   Well.     Hel-lo!  Nothing.  You gotta be fucking kidding me!  What's up?       Joni brought some home from Paul's garden the other day. They were huge!  No, but they're pushing them like crack at Whole Foods.  Honey...    Yeah, if you drink a thousand bottles a day!  I'm sorry.  What the hell is going on with you?  No. He's not!  Maybe you need to take some time off and recharge.  Because that's the way you like it! That's the way you keep control!  Oh come on! You hated it when I worked! You wanted me at home, taking care of the kids. You wanted a wife!  You didn't trust any of those nannies! And you sure as hell didn't back my career!  Yeah, so you can feel better about yourself!  Are you even attracted to me anymore?  81                                                                81    God, I feel so drugular right now. I really want a cigarette! Do you have any? I haven't had a cigarette since Laser was born. Do you smoke?    Do you think I'm just like some sad- sack middle-aged lesbian?  You want to get that?  83                                                                 83    Did you go to Home Depot?  That was fast!  What's that look?  The look you're giving me right now!  Look, I'm not gonna play this game with you! You need to keep your judgements to yourself!  I don't ask you why you keep blowing your nose constantly! I mean, if you have a drug problem that's your business...  Then why are you a gardener?!  Look, this isn't gonna work. I'll pay you through the end of the day and then we're done.  84                                                                   84     Okay...  We can't be doing this...  I'm married...  Yeah, and I love Nic.    That wasn't messy. That was fucked up. I'm totally fucked up...  Paul, don't...  I'm gonna do some planting over there so it won't look so bare...  Oh, I had to fire him.  Yeah, he had a drug problem.  Blow, I think...  (taken aback by Nic's  97                                                                 97       Where is this coming from?!    98                                                             98   No!  No. It has nothing to do with that!    No! Who said anything about fault? Just listen to me!  I just needed...  No, appreciated!  He's not just "other people!"  Where are you going?!  Hey Laser.     Honey?  Listen, I know you and Joni heard what's going on. I just want you to know that what happened with Paul and me is over. There's nothing going on now.  I know you might need some time to process your feelings around this, but I just want you to know that I'm here for you if you want to talk about anything. Is there anything you want to talk about?  (fighting the impulse to  Joni?  Can we just--  Okay.   I'm sorry.  Oh my god, I'm so sorry.   I should have called you.  Nic saw my hair in your bathroom.  Yeah.  Yeah.  Paul...  Paul, come on...    110                                                                110    Just getting another pillow.   The couch is kind of saggy.  It's a little ache-y.  Hey.    How was the party?  How big was it?  Are you drunk?  Don't talk to your mom like that!  Hey, I'm still your mother.  I can't believe this is our last dinner together.  I wish you were gay.    You'd be so much more sensitive.  I need to say something.  Look, it's no big secret your mom and are in hell right now. Bottom line...marriage is hard...really fucking hard. Just two people, slogging through the shit, year after year, getting older, changing. It's a fucking marathon, okay?!  So sometimes you're together so long, you just stop seeing the other person. You just see weird projections of your own junk. And instead of talking to each other, you go off the rails, and act grubby and make stupid choices. Which is what I did. And I feel sick about it because I love you guys and I love your mom and that's the truth. Sometimes you hurt the ones you love the most. I don't know why. Maybe if I read more Russian novels I would...  Anyway, I just wanted to say how sorry I am about what I did and that I hope you'll forgive me eventually. Thank you.  We wouldn't leave without saying goodbye.

They don't even have to know about it!  I never ask you for anything.  Will you quit saying that?    I don't have any expectations.  Well if he hadn't done it, you wouldn't be here. So respect, yo!  Right.  Thanks.  Okay.  I...uh...I didn't really have any specific questions...  Joni's the brains in the family. She won a National Merit Scholarship.  Yeah. And she got like an 800 on her Verbal SAT.  What? I'm just saying you're really smart.    Did you play any sports in school?  That's it?  I play some Soccer. Basketball. Baseball. I just met him once.  What?!  Paul!    I met him with Joni.  She set it up.  Our sperm donor.  Wait, did you guys think I was gay?!  You do?!                         You do?!  See what he did there, mom? You said "food-services industry," then he said "food-services industry..."  What's not nice is subjecting your kids to the same story 1000 times!  Mom, that's gross!  I'll get the ice-cream.  20-3...match point.  Mom, settle! I will...  Whatever, I have other plans anyway.  I said I'd do something with Paul!  I think he may be right, dude. Maybe this isn't such a good idea.   Seriously, dude, are you okay?  Clay's cool. He's just gets a little amped sometimes.  He's not a dick, that's just his way.    Hey, can I ask you a question?  Why'd you donate sperm?  So you did it to help people?  How much did you get paid?  I'm just curious.  That's it?  You were like 20 feet short, dude! There was no way.  Whatever.  Hey buddy.     Good boy.  I've seen this dog around.        I wonder if he's lost.  What?  Dude, don't do that.  Dude, Quit it!  Go!   Run!    Get out of here!  Why are you such a dick?!  That's H.  Lay-up.  Hey, can I ask you a question?  When you die do you want to be buried or cremated?  I want to be cremated.  Why? That's just taking up more space in the earth.  What do you care?   You won't even be conscious.    Don't quit your day job, mom.  You're right. I'm sorry, mom.  100                                                             100    What?  Okay.    Oh God, are you gonna cry?  It's gonna be weird not having you at home.  It's okay.     I can handle it.  I don't think you guys should break up.  I think you're too old.

That's no look.     That just my face.  Senora, I didn't give no looks!  I don't have no drug problem! I have the allergies!  Cause I love the flowers.

description: Nic and Jules are in a long term, committed, loving but by no means perfect same-sex relationship. Nic, a physician, needs to wield what she believes is control, whereas Jules, under that control, is less self-assured. During their relationship, Jules has floundered in her "nine to five" life, sometimes trying to start a business - always unsuccessfully - or being the stay-at-home mom. She is currently trying to start a landscape design business. They have two teen-aged children, Joni (conceived by Nic) and Laser (by Jules). Although not exact replicas, each offspring does more closely resemble his/her biological mother in temperament. Joni and Laser are also half-siblings, having the same unknown sperm donor father. Shortly after Joni's eighteenth birthday and shortly before she plans to leave the house and head off to college, Laser, only fifteen and underage to do so, pleads with her to try and contact their sperm donor father. Somewhat reluctantly, she does. He is late thirty-something Paul, a co-op farmer and restaurateur. Despite his seemingly successful businesses, Paul has always shirked responsibility, most specifically in his personal life. After Joni and Laser meet with Paul, Nic and Jules learn what their children have done and, although they don't want Paul infiltrating their lives, want to meet him - especially as Joni and Laser seem to want to maintain some sort of relationship with him. As Paul's relationship with the entire family grows (which includes his hiring Jules to design and construct his backyard), they have an effect on what he wants in life. In turn, he affects their family dynamic as well as each person's relationships outside of it.—Huggo
name: The Kids Are All Right
